org.pikater.web.vaadin.gui.server.layouts.formlayout

Class CustomFormLayout

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.vaadin.server.AbstractClientConnector
      • com.vaadin.ui.AbstractComponent
        • com.vaadin.ui.AbstractComponentContainer
          • com.vaadin.ui.AbstractLayout
            • com.vaadin.ui.AbstractOrderedLayout
              • com.vaadin.ui.VerticalLayout
                • org.pikater.web.vaadin.gui.server.layouts.formlayout.CustomFormLayout
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.vaadin.event.LayoutEvents.LayoutClickNotifier, com.vaadin.event.MethodEventSource, com.vaadin.navigator.View, com.vaadin.server.ClientConnector, com.vaadin.server.Sizeable, com.vaadin.shared.Connector, com.vaadin.ui.Component, com.vaadin.ui.ComponentContainer, com.vaadin.ui.HasComponents, com.vaadin.ui.HasComponents.ComponentAttachDetachNotifier, com.vaadin.ui.Layout, com.vaadin.ui.Layout.AlignmentHandler, com.vaadin.ui.Layout.MarginHandler, com.vaadin.ui.Layout.SpacingHandler, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Iterable<com.vaadin.ui.Component>, DialogCommons.IDialogResultValidator
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AgentUploadForm, CreateAccountForm, DatasetVisualizationForm, ChangePasswordForm, LoginForm, OptionValueForm, SaveExperimentForm, UserProfileForm

    public abstract class CustomFormLayout
extends com.vaadin.ui.VerticalLayout
implements DialogCommons.IDialogResultValidator, com.vaadin.navigator.View
    Our own version of FormLayout capable of much more, especially dynamic actions (enabling a button, for example) when a field is edited.
    Author:
    SkyCrawl
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • attachToButtonInterface

        public void attachToButtonInterface(com.vaadin.ui.Component component)
        Attach the given component (probably a button) to the button interface of this form layout. It is located at the bottom.

      • isFormUpdated

        public boolean isFormUpdated()
        At least one field's value is updated.

      • isFormValidAndUpdated

        public boolean isFormValidAndUpdated()
        All fields are valid (including the "required" attribute) and at least one is updated.

      • isResultReadyToBeHandled

        public boolean isResultReadyToBeHandled()
        Description copied from interface: DialogCommons.IDialogResultValidator
        This method is called when the "OK" button is clicked in the dialog. Use it to indicate whether conditions are prepared for handling the dialog result.
        Specified by:
        isResultReadyToBeHandled in interface DialogCommons.IDialogResultValidator
        Returns:
        true if no errors will occur when dialog result is handled

      • addField

        protected void addField(java.lang.String notificationDescription,
            com.vaadin.ui.AbstractField<? extends java.lang.Object> field)
        Only add fields with this method after all initializations have been made. The moment you add a field, value change events start affecting the form.

      • removeField

        protected void removeField(com.vaadin.ui.AbstractField<? extends java.lang.Object> field)
        Completely detach the field from the form leaving it in original state.

      • updateActionButton

        protected void updateActionButton()
        A.K.A.: set it enabled or disabled, depending on whether the form's fields are all valid and at least one is updated.

                                 T value)
        A small workaround that may sometimes come in handy for programmatic purposes.

      • getValueBackup

        protected static <T> T getValueBackup(com.vaadin.ui.AbstractField<T> field)

        Stores data in AbstractComponent.setData(Object), so don't use it for anything else if you use this method.

        Intended to be used together with setValueBackup(AbstractField, Object)

      • setValueBackup

        protected static <T> void setValueBackup(com.vaadin.ui.AbstractField<T> field,
                      T value)

        Gets the stored data from AbstractComponent.setData(Object), so don't use it for anything else if you use this method.

        Intended to be used together with #getValueBackup(AbstractField, Object)

      • isUpdated

        protected static <T> boolean isUpdated(com.vaadin.ui.AbstractField<T> field)
        For this method to work, the setCommitted(AbstractField) must first be called on the field.

      • setCommitted

        protected static <T> void setCommitted(com.vaadin.ui.AbstractField<T> field)
        Stores the current value as a backup so that isUpdated(AbstractField) can be used later.
